content:
TITLE: Implementing Markdown Parser and React Renderer in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to create a complete markdown parsing and rendering system using SimpleMarkdown. It includes customizing rules, creating parser and output functions, and defining a block parsing and output function. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/simple-markdown/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var rules = { ...SimpleMarkdown.defaultRules, paragraph: { ...SimpleMarkdown.defaultRules.paragraph, react: (node, output, state) => { return

{output(node.content, state)}

; } } }; var parser = SimpleMarkdown.parserFor(rules); var reactOutput = SimpleMarkdown.outputFor(rules, 'react')); var htmlOutput = SimpleMarkdown.outputFor(rules, 'html')); var blockParseAndOutput = function(source) { // Many rules require content to end in \n\n to be interpreted // as a block. var blockSource = source + "\n\n"; var parseTree = parser(blockSource, {inline: false}); var outputResult = htmlOutput(parseTree); // Or for react output, use: // var outputResult = reactOutput(parseTree); return outputResult; }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing TreeTransformer for Markdown Parse Tree Traversal in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: The TreeTransformer class is defined in tree-transformer.js. It traverses markdown parse trees in a post-order manner, allowing for optional transformation by inserting, reparenting, or removing nodes. It uses a TraversalState object to manage the traversal state and provide APIs for node manipulation. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus-linter/src/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` // Not provided in the original text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Rule Class for Lint Rule Representation in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: The Rule class, defined in rule.js, represents a single lint rule. It has a check() method that takes node, state, and content arguments. Rules can have a selector, a regular expression, and a function to determine if a node has lint issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus-linter/src/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` // Not provided in the original text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Selector Class for Markdown Parse Tree Node Matching in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: The Selector class, defined in selector.js, works like a CSS selector for markdown parse trees. It parses selector strings and provides a match() method to test if a node matches the selector during a TreeTransformer traversal. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus-linter/src/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` // Not provided in the original text ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing Expressions and Equations for Equality DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to compare mathematical expressions and equations to determine if they are equivalent. Two examples show comparing factored expressions and different forms of the same equation. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var expr1 = KAS.parse("(1-x)(-1-6x)").expr; var expr2 = KAS.parse("(6x+1)(x-1)").expr; KAS.compare(expr1, expr2).equal; // true var eq1 = KAS.parse("2w+50/w=25").expr; var eq2 = KAS.parse("w(12.5-w)=25").expr; KAS.compare(eq1, eq2).equal; // true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing Mathematical Expressions with KAS DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to parse a combination of plain text and LaTeX mathematical expressions using KAS. The example parses the expression and then prints its standardized form. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var expr = KAS.parse("3x \\frac{42}{42} sin^2y").expr; expr.print(); // "3*x*42/42*sin(y)^(2)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Advanced Expression Simplification DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the simplify() method to perform complex algebraic simplifications. The examples demonstrate simplifying exponents and fractions with variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var expr = KAS.parse("((nx^5)^5)/(n^-2x^2)^-3").expr; expr.print(); // "(n*x^(5))^(5)*(n^(-2)*x^(2))^(-1*-3)" expr.simplify().print(); // "n^(-1)*x^(31)" var expr = KAS.parse("(15np-25mp)/(15p^2-5p)+(20mp+10p^2)/(15p^2-5p)").expr; expr.print(); // "(15*n*p+-25*m*p)*(15*p^(2)+-5*p)^(-1)+(20*m*p+10*p^(2))*(15*p^(2)+-5*p)^(-1)" expr.simplify().print(); // "(-1+3*p)^(-1)*(3*n+-1*m+2*p)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Applying Non-Simplifying Transformations DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to perform non-simplifying transforms like expand() and factor() on expressions. The example shows expanding a product and then factoring it back to the original form. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var expr = KAS.parse("ab(c+d)e^f").expr; expr.print(); // "a*b*(c+d)*e^(f)" expr.expand().print(); // "a*b*e^(f)*c+a*b*e^(f)*d" expr.expand().factor().print(); // "a*b*e^(f)*(c+d)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing Inline Content in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to parse inline sub-content using the recurseParse function with a modified state object. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/simple-markdown/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var innerText = capture[1]; recurseParse(innerText, _.defaults({ inline: true }, state)); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Basic Expression Simplification DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the collect() method to perform basic transformations that simplify expressions. The examples demonstrate combining like terms and applying logarithm properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var expr = KAS.parse("1+1+x+x+x+y").expr; expr.collect().print(); // "2+3*x+y" var expr = KAS.parse("b^(2*y*log_b x)").expr; expr.collect().print(); // "x^(2*y)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Polar to Cartesian Coordinates (Radians) in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to convert polar coordinates to cartesian coordinates using kmath.point.cartFromPolarRad. The function accepts either separate length and angle parameters or a polar coordinate array, with angles measured in radians. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.point.cartFromPolarRad(2, Math.PI) => [-2, 0] // Note: a very small nonzero number is actually returned here, // due to numerical inaccuracy. kmath.point.cartFromPolarRad(Math.pow(2, 0.5), Math.PI/4) => [1, 1] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Polar to Cartesian Coordinates (Degrees) in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to convert polar coordinates to cartesian coordinates using kmath.point.cartFromPolarDeg. The function accepts either separate length and angle parameters or a polar coordinate array, with angles measured in degrees. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.point.cartFromPolarRad([2, 90]) => [-2, 0] // Note: a very small nonzero number is actually returned here, // due to numerical inaccuracy. kmath.point.cartFromPolarRad(Math.pow(2, 0.5), 45) => [1, 1] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Cartesian to Polar Coordinates (Degrees) in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates converting a cartesian point to polar coordinates with angles in degrees using kmath.point.polarDegFromCart. The example converts [0, 2] to polar form, returning the radius and angle in degrees. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.point.polarDegFromCart([0, 2]) => [2, 90] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Cartesian to Polar Coordinates (Radians) in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates converting a cartesian point to polar coordinates with angles in radians using kmath.point.polarRadFromCart. The example converts [1, 1] to polar form, returning the radius and angle in radians. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.point.polarRadFromCart([1, 1]) => [1.4142135623730951, 0.7853981633974483] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Distance to Line in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to find the distance from a point to a line using the kmath.point.distanceToLine function. The example calculates the distance from the origin to the horizontal line y = 5. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.point.distanceToLine([0, 0], [[-1, 5], [1, 5]]) => 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding Line Midpoint in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to find the midpoint of a line segment using kmath.line.midpoint. The example calculates the midpoint of a line from [0, 5] to [5, 0], resulting in [2.5, 2.5]. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.line.midpoint([[0, 5], [5, 0]]) => [2.5, 2.5] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reflecting Points Over Lines in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to reflect a point over a line using the kmath.point.reflectOverLine function. The example reflects the origin over the horizontal line y = 5, resulting in the point [0, 10]. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` kmath.point.reflectOverLine([0, 0], [[-1, 5], [1, 5]]) => [0, 10] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Evaluating Expressions with Variable Substitution DESCRIPTION: Shows how to evaluate a mathematical expression by substituting numerical values for variables. In this example, a Pythagorean formula is evaluated with x=3 and y=4 to get 5. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var expr = KAS.parse("(x^2+y^2)^.5").expr; expr.eval({x: 3, y: 4}); // 5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Illustrating Perseus Data Flow from Database to Renderer DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates the high-level data flow in Perseus, from database retrieval of a PerseusItem to the rendering process through ServerItemRenderer and Renderer components. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/docs/architecture.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` -> DB -> PerseusItem -> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing and Using Vector Operations in KMath DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import the vector module from KMath and use it to add two vectors together. This is a basic example showing the library's import pattern and function usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import {vector} from "@khanacademy/kmath"; vector.add([1, 2], [3, 4]) // [4, 6] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rotating a Point Using KMath DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the point module to rotate a point around an origin. This demonstrates the function signature pattern used throughout KMath where the subject is typically the first parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` point.rotateDeg([1, 1], 90, [0, 0]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Mathematical Conversion Function in KMath DESCRIPTION: Addition of a new function 'convertRadiansToDegrees' to the KMath package for converting angle measurements from radians to degrees. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#2190](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/2190) [`7ec6c2fbc`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/7ec6c2fbc21d3d7d4ef98a58e021da4684561447) Thanks [@nishasy](https://github.com/nishasy)! - Add convertRadiansToDegrees function to kmath ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Linear System Strings for Screen Readers DESCRIPTION: Update to the strings used for linear systems to improve screen reader compatibility and accessibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#2252](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/2252) [`e7ad604af`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/e7ad604afce45feab7d268582ec6db41d6ab5e06) Thanks [@nishasy](https://github.com/nishasy)! - [SR] Update Linear System strings ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Development Server DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the development server using PNPM. This starts the application in development mode, allowing you to test the math input functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/math-input/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Main KAS File to TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Converts the main KAS file to TypeScript, enabling type information for the library. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - [#1851](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/1851) [`46dc13f10`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/46dc13f10b97c22537e70e106540aa754c75b7b0) Thanks [@jeremywiebe](https://github.com/jeremywiebe)! - Convert main KAS file to TypeScript which enables types for the library ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Strict Typechecking for Function Parameters in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Enables strict typechecking of function parameters in the TypeScript configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - [#1889](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/1889) [`55a532175`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/55a532175192bfee3dc550c7eb7ce74d4a6542a9) Thanks [@benchristel](https://github.com/benchristel)! - Internal: enable strict typechecking of function parameters ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding ESLint Rule to Prevent Circular Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Implementation of an ESLint rule to detect and prevent circular dependencies in the codebase, improving code quality and build performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#2334](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/2334) [`6c5a0121d`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/6c5a0121dae2f0452baccc30401888379b5def95) Thanks [@handeyeco](https://github.com/handeyeco)! - Add Eslint rule "@typescript-eslint/no-restricted-imports" to help prevent circular dependencies ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Reverting to Dual Module Format (ESM and CJS) DESCRIPTION: Reverting previous changes to make the package ESM-only, now shipping with both CommonJS and ESM builds to maintain compatibility with different module systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#2339](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/2339) [`ef5fea555`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/ef5fea5551230f49af5b31705e84b23493f76883) Thanks [@jeremywiebe](https://github.com/jeremywiebe)! - Revert move to ESM-only packages (package again ships with CJS and ESM builds) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Moving to ESM-Only Package Format DESCRIPTION: Major change to remove CommonJS output, making the package ESM-only to align with modern JavaScript module standards. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#2331](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/2331) [`c2e33e522`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/c2e33e52291d6379799754e27c5d33b02ff4b1fa) Thanks [@jeremywiebe](https://github.com/jeremywiebe)! - Remove CJS output from package (package is now ESM only) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies with PNPM DESCRIPTION: Command to install all project dependencies using PNPM package manager. This needs to be run after cloning the repository and before starting the development server. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/math-input/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Perseus (bash) DESCRIPTION: Command to install project dependencies and tooling using pnpm package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Git Clone Command for Khan/math-input Repository DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the math-input project repository from GitHub to a local development environment. This is the first step in setting up the project for development or contribution. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/math-input/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone git@github.com:Khan/math-input.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Dependencies for Perseus Packages (bash) DESCRIPTION: Commands to update dev and peer dependencies for a specific package within the Perseus monorepo. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd packages/[package-name] // Example cd packages/perseus-editor // All dependencies pnpm add --dev [dependency name] // Include this too if webapp is using this dependency pnpm add --peer [dependency name] // Example pnpm add --dev @khanacademy/wonder-blocks-button pnpm add --peer @khanacademy/wonder-blocks-button ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building KAS Parser with PNPM DESCRIPTION: Instructions for rebuilding the parser after making changes to the parser generator. The commands install dependencies and generate a new parser. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm install pnpm build:parser ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building KAS Library with PNPM DESCRIPTION: Instructions for building the KAS library using PNPM package manager. These commands install dependencies and build the library. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm install pnpm build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Package Name Definition in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Defines the name of the package as @khanacademy/perseus-utils, which contains utilities used by most Perseus packages. The package is designed not to depend on any other Perseus packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus-utils/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # @khanacademy/perseus-utils ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Perseus Core Package DESCRIPTION: The package name used for importing Perseus Core utilities into other projects. This is the NPM package identifier for the core utility library used by the Perseus ecosystem. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus-core/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` @khanacademy/perseus-core ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Widgets File Path Reference DESCRIPTION: Reference to the location of example and test widgets within the Perseus editor codebase. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus-editor/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` ./testing-widgets.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Refactoring JavaScript Code to Use Optional Chaining DESCRIPTION: Updates code to use optional chaining to resolve new lint rule violations. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kas/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - [#1971](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/1971) [`341d316aa`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/341d316aa8727ebb9e7fde28fc4e2d8779aa3e82) Thanks [@jeremywiebe](https://github.com/jeremywiebe)! - Move to using optional chaining in a few places to resolve new lint rule violations. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Changing Package Import Structure for Internal References DESCRIPTION: Modification to use relative paths instead of package names for internal imports to improve module resolution and bundling. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/kmath/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#2328](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/2328) [`5b6e9df5b`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/5b6e9df5b6bcacf7646475ff7884415b815f68c5) Thanks [@jeremywiebe](https://github.com/jeremywiebe)! - Fix import of internal items to use relative paths instead of the package name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Major Change for Vite-based UI DESCRIPTION: Reference to a major version change that creates a Vite-based development user interface for viewing interactive graphs, including PR number and contributor information. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/dev/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - [#981](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/981) [`19d03492`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/19d03492ddcff884d385aa986cfbe44348ee43ac) Thanks [@benchristel](https://github.com/benchristel)! - Internal: Create a Vite-based dev UI for viewing interactive graphs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Minor Change for Graph Types Addition DESCRIPTION: Reference to a minor version change that adds more graph types to the development user interface, including PR number and commit information. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/dev/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - [#988](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/988) [`bbdb3377`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/bbdb3377bfca58933e7409c91b2f77dee3cb5f3d) Thanks [@benchristel](https://github.com/benchristel)! - Internal: Add more graph types to the dev UI ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Dependencies Update Reference DESCRIPTION: Reference to multiple dependencies that were updated in the same commit, listing the affected packages and their versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/dev/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` * Updated dependencies [[`a4ead994`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/a4ead9940cddc09434b823039ff51b85ecd9e639)]: - @khanacademy/math-input@17.0.8 - @khanacademy/perseus-linter@0.3.12 - @khanacademy/pure-markdown@0.2.15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Version Change Entry DESCRIPTION: Documentation of version changes including minor updates and patches with corresponding commit references and descriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` ## 12.2.0 ### Minor Changes - [#773] [`809823e4`] Fix text overlap in interactive graph widget * [#755] [`6d9e31a4`] Adding logic to ArticleRenderer so that it can return our currently focused element. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Version Reference Updates in Package.json DESCRIPTION: List of dependency version updates, including changes to @khanacademy/math-input, perseus-core, kas, kmath and other packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` - Updated dependencies [[`c431c4b8`], [`fb84640d`], [`376eb0e4`], [`33cc24c3`]]: - @khanacademy/math-input@14.2.1 - @khanacademy/perseus-core@1.2.0 - @khanacademy/kas@0.3.4 - @khanacademy/kmath@0.1.5 - @khanacademy/perseus-linter@0.3.7 - @khanacademy/pure-markdown@0.2.9 - @khanacademy/simple-markdown@0.10.3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Dependencies in package.json DESCRIPTION: Updates to package dependencies, including @khanacademy/perseus-linter, @khanacademy/kas, and @khanacademy/math-input. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` - Updated dependencies [[`f5a2cf521`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/f5a2cf521291180dbbd448adc97700f7c52c8b50), [`e19c58eb9`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/e19c58eb9f0ef84c32dfdb40a4382cfa4c82392d), [`96f0337ce`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/96f0337ce459dea6a0860b45704e188876d38720), [`f5a2cf521`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/f5a2cf521291180dbbd448adc97700f7c52c8b50)]: - @khanacademy/perseus-linter@1.2.0 - @khanacademy/kas@0.3.12 - @khanacademy/math-input@21.0.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Pull Request Links in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how pull request links are formatted in the changelog using Markdown syntax. It includes the PR number, commit hash, and author information. SOURCE: https://github.com/Khan/perseus/blob/main/packages/perseus/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [#1702](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/pull/1702) [`30725ec88`](https://github.com/Khan/perseus/commit/30725ec8812c3431cbe721e29e578aefe60e867d) Thanks [@handeyeco](https://github.com/handeyeco)! ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting Changelog Entries in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows the structure of individual changelog entries, including the pull request link, commit hash, author credit, and description of changes.
